metadata.description: User Directives Database helpers - READ-ONLY queries (getters)
metadata.notes: This registry is for import into MCP database. User directives is AI territory - AI is encouraged to write custom queries if helpers don't satisfy needs.

fields.name: Function name
fields.database: Which database this helper operates on
fields.purpose: Detailed description of what this helper does
fields.parameters: Array of parameter objects with name and type
fields.return_statements: Array of AI behavioral guidance - what to check/do next after calling this helper
fields.used_by_directives: Array of directive names that use this helper
fields.is_tool: Boolean - exposed via MCP as tool
fields.is_sub_helper: Boolean - internal utility helper not directly called by AI/directives
fields.calls_helpers: Array of helper names this function calls

note_to_ai: AI has freedom to write custom SQL queries for user_directives.db when existing helpers are insufficient. Use these helpers as a guide, but feel empowered to create optimized queries for specific needs.

helpers.name: get_user_directive
helpers.purpose: Retrieve single user directive by ID.
return_statements: Returns full directive with all fields including raw_content, validated_content, trigger_config, action_config
Check status field to see if directive is active, pending, or disabled
Review validation_questions/answers to understand clarifications made during setup
If None returned, directive doesn't exist - verify ID is correct
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directives
helpers.purpose: Retrieve multiple user directives by array of IDs.
return_statements: Returns list of directive objects for matching IDs
Useful for bulk retrieval of related directives
Returned list may be shorter than input if some IDs don't exist
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no directives found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_by_name
helpers.purpose: Retrieve user directive by name.
return_statements: Returns directive object matching name
User directive names should be unique - if multiple exist, only first is returned
If None returned, no directive with this name exists
helpers.error_handling: Return None if name not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directives_by_name
helpers.purpose: Retrieve multiple user directives by array of names.
return_statements: Returns list of directives matching names
Useful for bulk retrieval by name
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no directives found.

helpers.name: get_user_directives_by_action_type
helpers.purpose: Get all user directives filtered by action_type (e.g., 'execute_script', 'api_call', 'file_operation').
return_statements: Returns all directives that perform this type of action
Use this to understand what directives execute similar operations
If empty list, no directives of this action type exist
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directives_by_trigger_type
helpers.purpose: Get all user directives filtered by trigger_type (e.g., 'schedule', 'event', 'manual').
return_statements: Returns all directives triggered by this type
Use 'schedule' to find time-based directives, 'event' for event-driven ones
Review trigger_config field to understand specific trigger settings
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directives_by_status
helpers.purpose: Get all user directives filtered by status.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status to filter by (active, pending, disabled, etc.)

return_statements: Returns all directives with this status
Use status='active' to find currently running directives
Use status='pending' to find directives awaiting approval/deployment
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directives_by_implementation_status
helpers.purpose: Get all user directives filtered by implementation_status.

parameters.name: implementation_status
parameters.description: Implementation status (planned, in_progress, implemented, deployed, etc.)

return_statements: Returns all directives at this implementation stage
Use 'planned' to find directives that need implementation
Use 'deployed' to find directives that are live and running
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_execution
helpers.purpose: Retrieve execution stats for specific directive.
return_statements: Returns execution statistics including total_executions, success_count, error_count
Review last_error_time and last_error_message to diagnose issues
Check next_scheduled_time to see when directive will run next
Use avg_execution_time_ms and max_execution_time_ms to assess performance
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_directive
helpers.purpose: Get execution stats for specific user directive.
return_statements: Returns all execution records for this directive
Use this to understand directive execution history and reliability
High error_count may indicate directive needs debugging
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no execution records.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_avg_execution_time
helpers.purpose: Get directives filtered by average execution time (less/greater threshold).
return_statements: Use 'greater' to find slow-running directives that may need optimization
Use 'less' to find fast directives for performance comparison
Consider optimizing directives with avg > 5000ms
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_max_execution_time
helpers.purpose: Get directives filtered by maximum execution time (less/greater threshold).
return_statements: Max execution time shows worst-case performance
High max values may indicate intermittent slowdowns or edge cases
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_error_count
helpers.purpose: Get directives filtered by error count (less/greater threshold).
return_statements: Use 'greater' with threshold=0 to find all directives with errors
Prioritize fixing directives with high error counts
Review last_error_message for debugging clues
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_total_executions
helpers.purpose: Get directives filtered by total execution count (less/greater threshold).
return_statements: Use 'less' with threshold=1 to find directives that have never executed
Use 'greater' to find frequently-used directives
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_future_schedule
helpers.purpose: Get directives scheduled to execute between start and end times (future).
return_statements: Returns directives scheduled to run in specified time window
Use this to preview upcoming directive executions
Parses current time to filter only future schedules
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no scheduled executions in range.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_executions_by_past_schedule
helpers.purpose: Get directives that executed between start and end times (past).
return_statements: Returns directives that executed in specified time window
Use this to audit past directive activity
Parses current time to filter only past executions
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no executions in range.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependency
helpers.purpose: Retrieve single dependency by ID.
return_statements: Returns dependency info including type, name, version, status, install_command
Check status field to see if dependency is installed, pending, or failed
If required=true and status!=installed, directive cannot run
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependencies_by_directive
helpers.purpose: Get all dependencies for specific user directive.
return_statements: Returns all dependencies this directive needs
Check required field - if true and not installed, must install before running directive
Review install_command to understand how to install missing dependencies
If user_confirmed=false, get user approval before installing
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no dependencies.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependencies_by_type
helpers.purpose: Get all dependencies filtered by type (e.g., 'python_package', 'npm_package', 'system_binary').
return_statements: Returns all dependencies of this type across all directives
Useful for understanding what external dependencies user directives need
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependencies_by_status
helpers.purpose: Get all dependencies filtered by status (installed, pending, failed).
return_statements: Use status='pending' to find dependencies awaiting installation
Use status='failed' to find installation issues that need resolution
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependencies_by_required
helpers.purpose: Get all dependencies filtered by required flag.
return_statements: Use required=true to find critical dependencies that must be installed
Prioritize installing required dependencies over optional ones
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_dependencies_by_directive_required
helpers.purpose: Get all required dependencies for specific directive.
return_statements: More focused than get_user_directive_dependencies_by_directive - filters by required flag
Use this to check only critical dependencies before running directive
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_implementation
helpers.purpose: Retrieve implementation details by ID.
return_statements: Returns implementation info including file_path, function_name, language, framework, entry_point
Check deployed field to see if implementation is active
Use process_id to monitor or control running implementations
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_implementations_by_directive
helpers.purpose: Get all implementations for specific user directive.
return_statements: Returns all implementation records for this directive
Directive may have multiple implementations (e.g., Python and Bash versions)
Check deployed field to see which implementation is currently active
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no implementations.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_implementations_by_function_name
helpers.purpose: Get implementations by function name.
return_statements: Returns all implementations using this function name
Useful for finding reused function implementations across directives
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_implementations_by_file_path
helpers.purpose: Get implementations by file path.
return_statements: Returns all implementations in this file
Useful for understanding what directives are implemented in specific files
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_implementations_by_type
helpers.purpose: Get implementations by type (e.g., 'script', 'function', 'api_endpoint').
return_statements: Returns all implementations of this type
Useful for categorizing and organizing implementations
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_relationship
helpers.purpose: Retrieve single directive relationship by ID.
return_statements: Returns relationship info including source, target, relationship_type, active status
Check relationship_type to understand how directives interact (depends_on, triggers, etc.)
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_relationships_by_source
helpers.purpose: Get all relationships where directive is the source. Defaults to active=true.
return_statements: Returns all relationships originating from this directive
Use this to understand what other directives this one depends on or triggers
Only returns active relationships by default - set active=false to see inactive ones
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no relationships.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_relationships_by_target
helpers.purpose: Get all relationships where directive is the target. Defaults to active=true.
return_statements: Returns all relationships targeting this directive
Use this to understand what directives depend on or trigger this one
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no relationships.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_relationships_by_relationship
helpers.purpose: Get all relationships filtered by relationship_type. Defaults to active=true.
return_statements: Returns all relationships of this type across all directives
Useful for understanding dependency chains or trigger flows
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_function
helpers.purpose: Retrieve single user helper function by ID.
return_statements: Returns helper function info including file_path, parameters, purpose, function_signature
Check is_pure field to understand if function has side effects
Review implementation_status to see if helper is ready to use
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_functions
helpers.purpose: Retrieve multiple user helper functions by array of IDs.
return_statements: Returns list of helper functions for matching IDs
Useful for bulk retrieval
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no helpers found.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_function_by_name
helpers.purpose: Retrieve user helper function by name.
return_statements: Returns helper function matching name
If None returned, helper doesn't exist - may need to create it
helpers.error_handling: Return None if name not found.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_functions_by_name
helpers.purpose: Retrieve multiple user helper functions by array of names.
return_statements: Returns list of helpers matching names
Useful for bulk retrieval by name
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no helpers found.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_functions_by_path
helpers.purpose: Get all user helper functions in specific file.
return_statements: Returns all helpers defined in this file
Useful for understanding file organization
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no helpers in file.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_functions_by_implementation_status
helpers.purpose: Get user helpers filtered by implementation status.
return_statements: Use 'planned' to find helpers that need implementation
Use 'implemented' to find ready-to-use helpers
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_helper_functions_by_purity
helpers.purpose: Get user helpers filtered by purity (is_pure flag).
return_statements: Use is_pure=true to find pure functions (no side effects)
Pure functions are safer to call multiple times and easier to test
Prefer pure functions when possible for FP compliance
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_helper
helpers.purpose: Retrieve single directive-helper association by ID.
return_statements: Returns association info including execution_context, sequence_order, is_required
Check sequence_order to understand when helper should be called in directive workflow
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_helpers
helpers.purpose: Retrieve multiple directive-helper associations by array of IDs.
return_statements: Returns list of associations for matching IDs
Results ordered by sequence_order
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no associations found.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_helpers_by_directive
helpers.purpose: Get all helpers associated with specific directive. Ordered by sequence_order.
return_statements: Returns all helpers for this directive in execution order (sequence_order)
If is_required=true specified, only returns required helpers
Use sequence_order to call helpers in correct order during directive execution
Check is_required - required helpers must be called, optional ones can be skipped
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no helpers.

helpers.name: get_user_directive_helpers_by_function
helpers.purpose: Get all directives that use specific helper function. Ordered by sequence_order.
return_statements: Returns all directives using this helper function
Useful for understanding helper reuse across directives
If helper is modified, check all returned directives for compatibility
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no associations.

helpers.name: get_user_source_file
helpers.purpose: Retrieve source file metadata by ID.
return_statements: Returns source file info including format, checksum, parse_status, directive_count
Check parse_status - if 'failed', review parse_error_message
Compare file_checksum to current file to detect changes
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_user_source_file_by_path
helpers.purpose: Retrieve source file metadata by file path.
return_statements: Returns source file metadata for this path
Use this to check if file has been parsed before
If None returned, file hasn't been processed yet
helpers.error_handling: Return None if file_path not found.

helpers.name: get_user_source_files_by_parse_status
helpers.purpose: Get source files filtered by parse status.
return_statements: Use status='failed' to find files with parse errors that need attention
Use status='success' to find successfully parsed files
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no matches.

helpers.name: get_user_logging_config
helpers.purpose: Retrieve logging configuration by ID.
return_statements: Returns logging configuration with all settings
Check execution_logs_enabled and error_logs_enabled to see what's being logged
Review retention settings to understand log cleanup policies
helpers.error_handling: Return None if ID not found.

helpers.name: get_all_user_logging_config
helpers.purpose: Retrieve all logging configurations.
return_statements: Returns all logging configurations (typically only one exists)
Use this to understand current logging settings for user directives
helpers.error_handling: Return empty list if no configs exist.
